titleInfo.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to Mother, 1862, September 16

mods.abstract: 1862 September 16 Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to his Mother (Eleanor Griffin). Tells his mother that presently all is well, only after, having means of communication cut off and/or burned, thus having to forage for food, and supporting the batteries from the most dangerous position in town, while being shelled for hours by Rebel forces commandeered by Generals Morgan and Bragg. Practically out of ammunition, the battle finally comes to an end with the return of Maj. Gen. Rosencrans. Closes with news of their currently being under marching orders, and, being led by Rosencrans, will soon start through the South driving any Rebels in their path into the Gulf to drown.
